backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing a Bitcoin credit transfer system with balance management, transaction history, peer transfers, withdrawal requests, verification, admin access control, and Bitcoin price tracking with reserve management.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting frontend validation error display improvements in ManualVerificationForm and InstantFundingForm components with high confidence.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend files including components, pages, hooks, and utilities with details on authentication, Bitcoin transactions, admin features, and UI components.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS styles defining design tokens in OKLCH color space for light and dark modes, including transaction status colors, sidebar, charts, and base styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with root div and module script reference to main.tsx for the Bitcoin Credit Transfer application.
frontend/src/App.tsx: React application router configuration with QueryClient setup, defining all routes including dashboard, send/receive BTC, admin pages, and AdminRoute-protected admin routes.
frontend/src/components/auth/AdminAccess: Access denied screen displaying principal ID with copy functionality, session diagnostics showing token and access control status, and retry/sign-out/home navigation options.
Loading screen for admin verification with elapsed time counter, masked principal display, and retry/sign-out actions appearing after 10 seconds.
Route guard component that checks admin status using useIsCallerAdmin hook and renders AdminAccessLoadingScreen or AdminAccessDeniedScreen accordingly before allowing access to children.
frontend/src/components/auth/AdminTroubl: Displays a warning card when an authenticated user is not recognized as an admin, showing their principal ID with copy functionality and a retry button for re-checking admin status.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoggedOutSi: Renders a centered sign-in panel for unauthenticated users with a button to initiate Internet Identity login.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Provides a toggle button for signing in/out with Internet Identity, clearing query cache and admin status on logout.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Modal dialog that prompts authenticated users without a profile to enter their name, blocking interaction until profile setup is complete.
frontend/src/components/balance/AddressH: Displays a sortable list of all Bitcoin addresses generated by the user, showing status badges (active/used), creation dates, and actions to copy or view on blockchain explorer.
frontend/src/components/balance/BitcoinA: Shows the user's primary Bitcoin address with copy, QR code generation, and address rotation functionality, displaying notices when addresses are rotated.
frontend/src/components/balance/UsdEstim: Displays the estimated USD value for a given BTC amount based on current price, with loading states and unavailability handling.
frontend/src/components/buybtc/BuyBitcoi: Renders a table of Bitcoin purchase history sorted by verification date, showing transaction IDs, amounts, dates, and actions to copy or view transactions on blockchain explorer.
frontend/src/components/buybtc/InstantFu: React form component for instant Bitcoin funding that validates transaction IDs and BTC amounts, then records purchases via backend mutation. Displays current balance and provides immediate account credit feedback.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppHeader: Application header component that displays the app title and handles Internet Identity authentication with login/logout functionality. Clears query cache on logout.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Main layout wrapper component that renders the header and navigation bar with links to all major app sections (Dashboard, Send/Receive BTC, Buy, Withdraw, History, AI Lottery, Admin). Shows admin-specific navigation items conditionally.
frontend/src/components/reserve/AdminBro: Collapsible card component providing troubleshooting guidance and best practices for Bitcoin transaction broadcasting issues. Explains that broadcasting uses IC HTTP outcalls to public APIs without localhost connections.
frontend/src/components/reserve/AdminRes: Card component displaying placeholder UI for reserve balance monitoring with a notice that backend capabilities are not exposed. Suggests using external Bitcoin Core RPC or blockchain explorers.
frontend/src/components/reserve/BitcoinC: Collapsible card displaying a Python code snippet for querying Bitcoin Core node balance via RPC. Includes warnings that the script must be run externally and contains sensitive credentials.
frontend/src/components/reserve/External: Collapsible card component showing a Python script example for monitoring mining pool earnings and transferring to reserve wallet. Emphasizes the script must run externally with warnings about API key security.
frontend/src/components/reserve/ReserveM: React component for configuring and viewing Bitcoin multisig reserve settings (threshold, public keys, address, redeem script). Displays a warning that backend implementation is not yet complete.

Collapsible card component that displays Python code snippet for creating Bitcoin Core multisig addresses externally. Warns users that the code must be run outside the app since Internet Computer cannot connect to localhost.
frontend/src/components/transfers/bestPr: Defines best practices documentation entries for troubleshooting common issues like missing backend methods, HTTP outcall failures, and localhost connectivity problems in IC Bitcoin integration.
frontend/src/components/transfers/BestPr: Searchable and filterable component that displays best practices for Bitcoin transfers. Auto-suggests relevant topics based on transfer failure patterns and error contexts (e.g., backend method missing, HTTP outcall failures, rate limiting).
frontend/src/components/transfers/Broadc: Collapsible alert component explaining how Bitcoin transaction broadcasting works in the app. Emphasizes that private keys must never be entered and that signing must be done externally while broadcasting uses IC HTTP outcalls.
frontend/src/components/transfers/Mainne: Alert component displaying important mainnet Bitcoin transaction information including irreversibility, reserve-funded fees, confirmation times, and Segwit support.
frontend/src/components/transfers/Provid: Card component that displays detailed broadcast attempt logs from blockchain API providers, showing success/failure status, HTTP responses, and error messages in collapsible format.
frontend/src/components/transfers/Segwit: Displays detailed information about a Segwit Bitcoin transaction including destination address, amount, estimated fee, and transaction hash with copy-to-clipboard functionality and mainnet warning.
frontend/src/components/transfers/Transa: Shows real-time blockchain confirmation progress for Bitcoin transactions with a progress bar, estimated time remaining, and links to blockchain explorer; polls for confirmation updates.
Renders status badges for Bitcoin transactions based on signing status, broadcast status, and confirmation count with appropriate icons and colors.
frontend/src/components/transfers/Transf: Displays a table of transaction history with expandable rows showing detailed mainnet transaction information including status badges, confirmation progress, and Segwit details.
frontend/src/components/verification/Man: Form component for admins to manually verify Bitcoin purchases by entering transaction ID and BTC amount with validation, error handling, and success feedback.
frontend/src/components/verification/Ver: Displays a sortable table of verified Bitcoin purchases with transaction IDs, amounts, dates, and verifier principals. Includes copy-to-clipboard and external blockchain explorer links for each transaction.
frontend/src/components/withdrawals/Admi: Admin table component for managing withdrawal requests with filtering by status (pending/paid/rejected), sortable columns, and action buttons for approving, rejecting, and marking requests as paid.
Admin dashboard showing withdrawal request statistics (pending/paid/rejected counts) and a table for processing requests. Includes manual payment processing workflow with confirmation dialogs.
frontend/src/components/withdrawals/Exte: Collapsible developer reference component displaying code examples for integrating external payout APIs (PayPal OAuth/Payouts and Stripe payouts) with copy-to-clipboard functionality.
frontend/src/components/withdrawals/With: User-facing component displaying withdrawal request history with tab-based filtering by status (all/pending/paid/rejected) and detailed card view showing amount, method, and account information.
Summary card showing user's withdrawal request counts by status (pending/paid/rejected) with a link to request new withdrawals and a note about external payment processing.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous actor instance for backend communication, invalidating dependent queries when the actor changes based on Internet Identity authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useAiReserveMonitorin: Hook that manages AI reserve monitoring preference in localStorage, returning a boolean state and setter that defaults to true (enabled).
frontend/src/hooks/useFundedWithdrawalNo: Hook that polls for withdrawal requests every 30 seconds and displays toast notifications when requests transition to PAID status, tracking notified requests per user to avoid duplicate alerts.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides React context and hooks for Internet Identity authentication, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports React Query hooks for fetching and mutating backend data including user balances, profiles, transactions, peer transfers, withdrawals, verifications, Bitcoin purchases, and admin operations.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes using OKLCH color space, defining colors for UI components, transaction statuses, and financial card styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the root component wrapped with QueryClientProvider for React Query and InternetIdentityProvider for authentication.
frontend/src/pages/AdminAddressManagemen: Admin page displaying all user Bitcoin addresses with statistics, search functionality, and actions to copy addresses or view them in blockchain explorers.
Displays admin credentials including principal ID, account balance in BTC with USD estimate, admin status verification badge, and a list of admin capabilities like managing withdrawals and verifying Bitcoin purchases.
frontend/src/pages/AdminManualVerificati: Provides a manual Bitcoin verification interface for recording historical purchases and special cases, featuring a form to enter transaction IDs and amounts, plus a verification history table showing all manually verified purchases.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx: Admin dashboard showing system overview with cards for pending withdrawals, recent transactions, reserve status, and peer transfers, plus navigation links to withdrawal management, peer transfers, manual verification, and user credit distribution.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPeerTransfersPag: Displays and monitors all peer-to-peer credit transfers with filtering by status (pending/approved/rejected/deleted), showing transfer details including sender, recipient, amounts, and timestamps in a sortable table with copy-to-clipboard functionality.
Form for admins to credit BTC directly to a user account by entering their Principal ID, Bitcoin transaction ID, and amount, with validation and USD estimate display to prevent duplicate credits.
frontend/src/pages/AdminSendToUserPage.t: Allows admins to search for users by name or Principal ID from a list of all system users, select a recipient, enter a BTC amount, and send credits with a confirmation dialog before executing the transfer.
frontend/src/pages/AdminVerificationRequ: File appears to be empty or truncated in the provided content.
frontend/src/pages/AiLotteryPage.tsx: Generates AI-powered lottery number predictions with three outcomes, attempting to fetch live draw data from data.ny.gov and falling back to simulated historical data if unavailable.
frontend/src/pages/BuyBitcoinPage.tsx: Displays user's BTC balance and provides a form to submit external Bitcoin purchase transactions for instant account funding, along with purchase history.
frontend/src/pages/BuyCreditsPage.tsx: Shows current BTC balance and placeholder UI for future credit purchase integration with external payment providers.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Main dashboard displaying user's BTC balance, Bitcoin address, custodial model warning, and navigation cards for send/receive/withdraw/buy operations plus withdrawal status summary.
frontend/src/pages/HistoryPage.tsx: Displays transaction history with summary statistics (total transactions, credits received/spent) and mainnet transaction status tracking, with support for auto-opening specific transfer requests.
Lists all approved peer-to-peer transfers received by the user, showing sender information, amounts, and timestamps with clipboard copy functionality.
Displays a list of approved outgoing peer-to-peer credit transfers sent by the current user, with copy-to-clipboard functionality and status badges.
frontend/src/pages/PuzzleRewardsPage.tsx: Placeholder page for a puzzle rewards system that shows an alert indicating the feature is not yet implemented in the backend.
frontend/src/pages/ReceiveBtcPage.tsx: Page for receiving Bitcoin that displays a Bitcoin address with QR code, includes tabs for active address and address history, and provides instructions for receiving BTC.
frontend/src/pages/SendBtcPage.tsx: Form page for sending Bitcoin to external addresses with Segwit validation, balance checking, network selection, and detailed transaction broadcasting diagnostics including provider status and confirmation progress.
frontend/src/pages/SendToPeerPage.tsx: Form page for transferring credits to another user within the platform using Principal IDs, with recipient validation, profile lookup, balance checking, and confirmation dialog.
frontend/src/pages/TransferTroubleshooti: Troubleshooting guide page that explains the missing sendBTC backend method, displays implementation requirements, and provides best practices for when the feature is implemented.
frontend/src/pages/WithdrawPage.tsx: React component for user withdrawal requests, allowing users to specify amount, payment method (PayPal/Stripe), and account details. Displays success confirmation and withdrawal history after submission.
frontend/src/types/mainnet.ts: TypeScript type definitions for mainnet Bitcoin transactions, including signing/broadcast status enums, extended transaction interfaces, and result types for BTC operations and confirmation analysis.
frontend/src/utils/adminStatusCache.ts: Utility for caching admin verification status per principal in localStorage with 5-minute TTL and in-memory session tracking to ensure fresh checks on new page loads.
frontend/src/utils/errors.ts: Error normalization utility that formats backend error messages into user-friendly strings, handling validation errors, authorization failures, and transaction-specific issues.
frontend/src/utils/fundedNotificationSto: Per-principal localStorage store for tracking which withdrawal request IDs have been notified as PAID to prevent duplicate notifications across sessions.
frontend/src/utils/transactionStatus.ts: Utility functions for Bitcoin transaction status management, including status message generation, confirmation progress calculation, Segwit address validation, and polling determination.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: URL parameter parsing utilities supporting both hash-based and browser routing, with sessionStorage persistence for maintaining state like admin tokens across navigation.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration file defining custom color schemes using OKLCH color space, typography settings with Inter and JetBrains Mono fonts, container queries, animations for accordions, and custom shadows for a financial application UI.
project_state.json: Project state tracking file documenting pending feature requests to fix manual Bitcoin purchase balance updates and implement backend validation for transaction IDs and BTC amounts, with one known issue about manual inputs not instantly reflecting on balance.
